title: Don't Stop the Multi-Party! On Generating Synthetic Multi-Party Conversations with Constraints
author: Nicolò Penzo (Fondazione Bruno Kessler, Italy), Marco Guerini (Fondazione Bruno Kessler, Italy), Bruno Lepri (Fondazione Bruno Kessler, Italy), Goran Glavaš (University of Würzburg, Germany), Sara Tonelli (Fondazione Bruno Kessler, Italy), ...
relevance_why: The development of synthetic multi-party conversations could inform personalized conversation generation, which is relevant to voice synthesis and audio language modeling tasks.
background: Generating diverse and structured multi-party conversations for various applications by constraining language models to replicate natural conversational dynamics.
contribution: This paper introduces a framework to generate synthetic multi-party conversations by enforcing constraints on dialogue structure and participant stances, achieving high-quality and varying interaction patterns.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods for synthesizing dialogues mainly focus on two-party interactions or limited participants, which restricted the complexity of conversational dynamics.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves upon existing models by systematically generating multi-party conversations with four to six speakers, thereby enhancing structural diversity and interaction complexity.

key_innovation: Utilizes instruction-tuned Large Language Models to generate synthetic conversations in both one-pass and turn-by-turn manners while maintaining diverse interaction patterns.
real_world_impact: The generation of enriched synthetic datasets can improve training for dialogue systems and enhance applications in conversational AI, allowing for more robust interactivity in tools such as virtual assistants.
limitations: Limitations include the focus on English and US-centric topics, which may affect generalizability to other languages and contexts.

new_terms.Multi-Party Conversations (MPCs): **Multi-Party Conversations (MPCs)** refer to discussions involving more than two participants, characterized by complex interaction dynamics.
new_terms.instruction-tuned Large Language Models: **Instruction-tuned Large Language Models** are a class of models optimized to follow instructions or constraints more effectively during text generation.

open_sourcing: The code for generation and evaluation of the MPCs is available at the GitHub repository: https://github.com/dhfbk/Constrained-SyntheticMPC
